news.title: RBI cuts key rate by 25 bps to 5.25% amid robust GDP growth, record low inflation
news.para: The Reserve Bank of India on Friday announced a 25 basis points reduction in the policy repo rate, bringing it down to 5.25 per cent.

news.title: Every building in Amaravati will stand out with distinctive design: Andhra Pradesh CM
news.para: Amaravati is being developed as a creative city with distinctive architecture and abundant greenery, as announced by Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu. The CRDA Authority approved significant proposals, including the Governor's residence complex and a Rs 7,380 crore loan for infrastructure. Beautification works and statues commemorating Telugu icons are also planned.

news.title: Rajasthan government stops society ‘patta’ registrations after years of ignoring red flags
news.para: Rajasthan government has halted property registrations based on housing society 'pattas' to curb unregulated real estate and unauthorized colonies. This move aims to protect buyers misled by informal documentation, mandating a 90-A conversion for legal recognition. However, lawyers are protesting, claiming it unfairly impacts low-income citizens and empowers land mafias.

news.title: After Sebi, Amfi likely to put equity tag on REITs in January 2026 rejig
news.para: Mutual fund investors should watch for changes in January 2026. AMFI may reclassify REITs like KRT and Embassy into mid-cap equity. Mindspace, Nexus, and Brookfield could join small-cap equity. This follows SEBI's move to boost mutual fund participation in REITs. Fund managers will need to adjust portfolios accordingly. The official list arrives in early January.

news.title: Haryana imposes ₹45 crore in environment compensation, recovers less than 1%
news.para: Haryana has collected less than 1% of the Rs 45 crore in environmental compensation imposed on over 400 industrial and commercial units in the last three years. Significant outstanding dues from stone crushers, mining, and textile units highlight enforcement challenges, prompting the National Green Tribunal to seek government responses on the failure to recover funds meant for environmental restoration.

news.title: Nashik civic body collects ₹196 crore property tax in current fiscal year
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation saw an 8% rise in property tax collection. Rs 196 crore was collected in eight months. This increase was driven by discount schemes for prompt payers and waivers for defaulters. The civic body aims to collect Rs 275 crore this financial year. Action will be taken against remaining defaulters.

news.title: Kolkata: NKDA issues notices to 37 New Town buildings
news.para: The New Town Kolkata Development Authority (NKDA) has issued stop operation notices to 37 residential buildings for illegally running hotels and guest houses without permission. These operations violate state urban development department notifications and pose fire hazard risks. NKDA is now issuing provisional no objection certificates for partial commercial use of residential buildings, requiring final permission for a 5-year tenure.

news.title: HC reopens building violation case, owners in Gurugram's DLF 1-5 can file objections
news.para: Homeowners in DLF 1 to 5 have until December 31 to file objections regarding illegal construction and commercial misuse of their properties. The Punjab and Haryana High Court has ordered the Town and Country Planning Department to consider these objections. A status report will be filed with the court within 45 days. The next hearing is scheduled for January 15.

news.title: Court orders confiscation of ₹128-crore assets in Uttar Pradesh's first FEOA case
news.para: A significant ruling from a special court in Lucknow has led to the confiscation of assets totaling approximately Rs 128 crore from the Shine City Group and its elusive promoter, Rashid Naseem. This decisive action is a key aspect of the Enforcement Directorate's initiative targeting fugitive economic offenders.

news.title: Mumbai-based real estate firm, its two directors booked for cheating investors of ₹31 crore
news.para: Mumbai police have launched an investigation into Ranbeer Real Estate Developers LLP and its leadership. Accusations of defrauding 19 investors out of a staggering Rs 31 crore have surfaced, with claims that the company lured individuals with promises of lucrative returns from a redevelopment initiative.

news.title: Brookfield India REIT launches QIP to raise up to ₹3,500 crore
news.para: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust is set to raise up to Rs 3,500 crore. The company has launched a Qualified Institutional Placement issue to gather these funds. Unitholders previously approved this fundraising plan. The issue opened on December 4, 2025, with a floor price of Rs 327.33 per unit.

news.title: DDA's owes ₹17,000 crore in liabilities, over 34,000 of its flats unsold: Lok Sabha told
news.para: With liabilities nearing Rs 17,000 crore, the Delhi Development Authority is keeping up with its financial obligations. Despite a surplus of unsold flats in Narela, the agency is rolling out new housing options this financial year in Karkardooma and Narela. The DDA remains proactive in managing its real estate inventory and fiscal duties.

news.title: No GST on leasing out residential premises as hostel for students: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has made a significant ruling, stating that leasing residential properties for student and professional hostels is exempt from Goods and Services Tax. By affirming the Karnataka High Court's earlier decision, the court emphasizes the importance of preserving the original legislative intent regarding residential use exemptions.

news.title: SC grants one week interim protection to petitioners facing property demolition in Uttar Pradesh
news.para: The Supreme Court has stepped in to offer a week of protection for individuals in Uttar Pradesh dealing with impending property demolitions, effectively freezing the situation for now. The court has instructed petitioners to turn to the Allahabad High Court for additional directions.

news.title: SC directs Noida authority to act on Sports City proposals; interim relief granted to multiple builders
news.para: The Supreme Court has directed developers in Noida’s Sports City case to submit revised proposals within two weeks and ordered Noida Authority to act within four weeks. It recorded a new payment framework, allowed zero-period benefits, permitted conditional OCs for some towers, and let the CBI probe continue without arrests. Further hearing is in January 2026.

news.title: Smartworks leases 1.68 lakh sq ft in Kolkata; 91Springboard adds over one lakh sq ft in Bengaluru & Chennai
news.para: Smartworks Coworking Spaces has secured a 1.68 lakh sq ft in Kolkata for a global IT firm, which will operate across two distinct campuses. Concurrently, 91Springboard has launched two hubs in Bengaluru and Chennai, accommodating a total of 2,500 seats, with plans for them to be operational by February 2026.

news.title: Illegal water connections found in Rajasthan housing board colony
news.para: Public Health Engineering Department officials found seventy illegal water connections in Ratnagiri Apartment. This discovery is expected to lead to a broader inquiry into unauthorized water usage across Rajasthan Housing Board colonies. Many residents in Indira Gandhi Nagar and Pratap Nagar reportedly have illegal connections. PHED plans a crackdown on these unauthorized links.

news.title: Minister hints at possible third phase of land pooling for Amaravati
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government will continue its Land Pooling Scheme (LPS) for upcoming capital city projects, with a potential phase-III for an international airport and smart industries. The development plan emphasizes an eco-friendly capital with 30% designated as blue and green zones, featuring extensive recreational facilities and landscaping.

news.title: Homebuyers of 129 real estate projects must approach IRPs, not UP-RERA
news.para: UP-RERA has issued a public advisory for homebuyers. One hundred twenty-nine real estate projects from fourteen developers are now in Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process. Affected buyers must file claims with Insolvency Resolution Professionals. UP-RERA's jurisdiction is suspended during this period.

news.title: Upalokayukta orders action against illegal constructions near Srirangapatna
news.para: Karnataka Upalokayukta Justice B Veerappa has ordered revenue officials in Mandya to act against illegal constructions, including Chandravana Ashrama, on encroached government land along the Cauvery riverfront.  These properties, built without mandatory buffer zones and approvals, have even altered the river's course. Officials are directed to demarcate encroachments and initiate action within one month.
